neighbors.name: Blue Star Dairy Farms
neighbors.claims: Blue Star Dairy Farms operates large dairy facilities in both Dane and Columbia counties, with roughly 3,915 total head of livestock across its two farm sites [WPR](https://www.wpr.org/news/dairy-cafo-consolidate-grow-herd-thousands-wisconsin). It has been family-owned for multiple generations since 1946, now run by third-generation members of the Meinholz family [Mid-West Farm Report](https://www.midwestfarmreport.com/2024/05/14/blue-star-dairy-farms-is-your-host/). One co-owner, Sherri Meinholz, serves on the Vienna Town Board as Supervisor #2 [Wisconsin Custom Operators](https://wiscustomoperators.org/directory/details/251/Blue-Star-Dairy-Farms) [Town of Vienna](https://viennawi.gov/town-board-officials/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via formal channels given her official role, emphasizing the project’s respect for farmland and local decision-making. Highlight shared values around preserving agricultural land and acknowledge the Meinholz family’s longstanding legacy in the community.

neighbors.name: Cynthia M. LaValley
neighbors.claims: Cynthia M. LaValley is a local landowner in the Town of Vienna with no known public roles or outspoken involvement in community development issues [Town of Vienna](https://viennawi.gov/town-board-officials/).

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect through a personal, community-oriented approach. Emphasize respect for her family’s long-time connection to the land and discuss plans in a way that honors her property’s legacy.

overview_summary: Two neighbors were profiled: a prominent family-run dairy farm and a private landowner. Neither has made a clear public statement for or against the development; the farm owner is a town official whose stance is handled separately, and the other landowner’s position remains unknown. Community influence is concentrated with Blue Star Dairy Farms (high influence), while Cynthia LaValley has low public influence.
